sentences.sentence: Ukrainian officials say Russia is more concerned with covering up the scale of the losses and is willing to abandon its troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the Kremlin claims it always retrieves its dead, it has not announced the number of Russian troops killed in war-torn Ukraine since March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russian forces have sustained heavy losses after Ukraine's military prevented the opposition from crossing the strategic Sivertsky-Donetsk river in the Donbas region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kim Jong-un. It's led to the first death since the start of the pandemic, and there are fears a major outbreak could be hugely damaging to the nation of 25 million people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: North Korea is already struggling with a lack of medicine, food shortages and an economy weakened by sanctions and a total shutdown of its borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: 27 people are reported to have died from the coronavirus, but about half a million are thought to have developed fevers since the end of last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: North Korea has a very low vaccination rate after rejecting international offers of vaccines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Officials argued they'd controlled the spread of COVID by closing off all borders since January 2020. South Korea has offered aid to its northern neighbor, but Pyongyang has yet to respond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For many Earthlings on Sunday, the moon will appear to briefly turn red, marking this year's first total lunar eclipse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The rare visual is the result of the moon passing through the Earth's shadow, blocking much of the sun's light from reaching our nearest neighbor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The wonderful thing is that when the moon is entirely in the shadow, when it's in the darkest part of the shadow, the moon will actually look to your eyes to be kind of rose-colored or orange-colored.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And that's actually because your eyes are adjusting to that darker light.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And in fact, the only light getting up to the moon at this point is light that is scattering through the Earth's atmosphere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The event comes as scientists are preparing to return to the moon's surface.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Next year, NASA will attempt to land a lunar rover called Viper. It will look for resources on the moon's surface so that the agency could one day establish a base camp on their celestial neighbor. But for now, people around the world will be able to see a rare event that has inspired humans for much of our history.
